question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [No State Root Check] Is there verification that state values correspond to a valid state root, or can arbitrary combinations be accepted? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [No Validator Set Check] Does the code verify that epoch changes align with validator set updates, or can fake epochs be injected? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [No Block Hash Verification] Is there any verification that block_height corresponds to a valid block hash? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Non-Standard Headers] Can attackers inject non-standard Aptos headers that get parsed and override standard values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Header Version Mismatch] If header format changes across API versions, can clients be confused by mixing old and new header formats? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Missing Required Headers] Does the code properly enforce that all required headers are present, or can partial state be created? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Memory Exhaustion] Can repeated calls to from_headers() with large cursor strings cause memory exhaustion through String allocation? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [CPU Exhaustion] Can specially crafted header values cause excessive CPU usage during parsing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Fuzzing Coverage] Has from_headers() been fuzzed with malformed header values to discover parsing vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Property Testing] Are there property-based tests ensuring state invariants hold for all possible header combinations? (Low)
